headers.subject: Re: [authors] Migrating to the new Template
headers.x-spam-status: No, score=-2.4 required=5.0 tests=BAYES_00,NO_RELAYS autolearn=disabled version=3.2.4

quote.quotepara: This is mostly for User Guide authors. Tim has finished the new template for the User Guide. He has also written a HOWTO explaining how to use it.
We haven't figured out how to download files from Plones. So I put up those documents in the old web page:
Tim, could you exlain to us how to migrate a document from one template to another? What is the best way to do that?

body.para: The only way I know of is very tedious. Cut and paste into the new template, then go about applying the correct styles (OOoHeading1 for Heading1, and so on). I guess better done now than later. I will go to work on the Impress doc, and this is all stuff that can be done over time (it will take me a while for the 50+ page Impress guide). Eventually we should have all docs with the same styles though. The most important thing is to start using the template for all new docs right away.

I do recall seeing someone on the Users list some time ago mention something about Find and Replace for styles (is that vague enough for ya?). However, I can't remember what the final answer was, whether or not this is something that OOo is capable of. I'll check it out....

Also, as editors, it's up to Jim T. and myself to make sure that all docs are formatted consistently (of course, any help will be greatly appreciated). It's not really hard, but as I said, tedious. But once all docs are formatted consistently it will be much easier to integrate them.

quote.quotepara: Also, I have a question about the front page. We are currently thinking of dividing each guide (e.g. Migration Guide) into several parts, so different volunteers can work on different sections simultaneously. Now, does it really make sense for each small section to have a front page? I figure that there should be only one front page per guide.

Also, regarding the copyright notices. What should we do with those when the documents are compiled into one single User Guide? Does it really make sense to have 40 copyright notices sprinkled every 7 pages in the User Guide?

body.para: The idea of the template is to give authors everything they need to format any doc for OOo. If they don't need the title page, they can delete it. Same with the TOC, Index, PDL, etc. However, if they do need any or all of these, then they are conveniently there for the authors to use.

If an author is frequently writing small sections without a TOC, Index, PDL, and so on, he/she could delete the unnecessary stuff and save a new OOoLite template that still has all the relevant OOo styles. An author can make as many of these customized templates as she/he needs. Does this make sense?
